author: jeffbi

comments.author: jeffbi
comments.body:
Now catching CIM exceptions, but no longer checking specifically for the namespace-not-found error. This is essentially what the cmdlet does.

A separate PR will cover the 2nd cause for the cmdlet returning empty DeviceGuard information

comments.author: jeffbi
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT, can you look at this when you have time?

comments.author: mirichmo
comments.body: @jeffbi Please update this PR now that I merged #3339

comments.author: jeffbi
comments.body: @mirichmo this PR has been updated, and is now the same as #3339 except for a simplified commit message. It may or may not be worth keeping this one.

comments.author: mirichmo
comments.body:
@jeffbi The code changes look the same to me, unless I missed an important detail when skimming it. If the only difference is a commit message, lets close this PR.

Please reopen it if there is an important change that needs merging.

title: Make Get-ComputerInfo tests handle "no CIM DeviceGuard namespace" case
